p:
In December 2014, the Innovative Medicines Initiative awarded funding from the Ebola + programme to the EBOVAC1 consortium of research institutions in partnership with the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson (Janssen) to support the development and evaluation of a prime-boost prophylactic Ebola vaccine regimen.
2, 3 The EBOVAC-Salone study in Sierra Leone, which is still ongoing, is part of the EBOVAC1 project.
